item.title:

item.title: R to @random_snakes: So, basically, some snakes see like the creature in "The Predator" movies, or at least that is the theory. This is so they can track prey in low light, or even in water if it's a mammal. Snakes also have a great sense of smell.
item.dc:creator: @random_snakes
item.description: So, basically, some snakes see like the creature in "The Predator" movies, or at least that is the theory. This is so they can track prey in low light, or even in water if it's a mammal. Snakes also have a great sense of smell.

item.title:
"Vipers, pythons and boa constrictors all use infrared vision to locate their prey, but the exact source of this slithery sixth sense is unknown" -See more on this topic in this article:
https://physicsworld.com/a/snake-vision-inspires-pyroelectric-material-design/

item.title:
R to @Woopxgsooie: Yeah, snakes are amazing! 🤯🐍🫶🥰
1) Blue insularis viper. It is venomous. The heat pits are the triangle-shaped hole between the eye and nostril.
2) Green tree python, many heat-sensing pits along the sides of the face
3) Rattlesnake, is a viper, heat pits near it's nostrils
item.dc:creator: @random_snakes
item.description:
Yeah, snakes are amazing! 🤯🐍🫶🥰

1) Blue insularis viper. It is venomous. The heat pits are the triangle-shaped hole between the eye and nostril.

2) Green tree python, many heat-sensing pits along the sides of the face

3) Rattlesnake, is a viper, heat pits near it's nostrils

item.title: RT by @random_snakes: Faux News, you do realize that Ultra-Maga is a synonym for Ultra-Nazi, right?
item.dc:creator: @AndySzilagyi
item.description: Faux News, you do realize that Ultra-Maga is a synonym for Ultra-Nazi, right?

item.title: R to @Woopxgsooie: Only the middle two are nostril holes. The other holes are heat-sensing pits so they can detect their prey's body heat because they prey on mammals. Not all snakes have this, some snakes hunt by smell and vision. Pythons and vipers have heat pits.
item.dc:creator: @random_snakes
item.description: Only the middle two are nostril holes. The other holes are heat-sensing pits so they can detect their prey's body heat because they prey on mammals. Not all snakes have this, some snakes hunt by smell and vision. Pythons and vipers have heat pits.
